title: .cpu().numpy()[0] too many indices for array in pytorch 0.4
body_html:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
I am using pytorch 0.4 installed from conda. I got an error when using the below code

  File "train.py", line 378, in main
    loss += loss_.data.cpu().numpy()[0]/args.iter_size
IndexError: too many indices for array

When I downgrade pytorch to 0.3.1, this error disappears and the code run well. What should I change to run with the new version of pytorch?

  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.4
  • Python version: 3.6
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1
  • GPU models and configuration: TitanX

body:
If you have a question or would like help and support, please ask at our
I am using pytorch 0.4 installed from conda. I got an error when using the below code
```
  File "train.py", line 378, in main
    loss += loss_.data.cpu().numpy()[0]/args.iter_size
IndexError: too many indices for array
```
When I downgrade pytorch to 0.3.1, this error disappears and the code run well. What should I change to run with the new version of pytorch?

- How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): conda
- OS: Ubuntu 16.04
- PyTorch version: 0.4
- Python version: 3.6
- CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.1
- GPU models and configuration: TitanX
